name: Mount Shasta
longDescription:
Siskiyou County, California, USA Mount Shasta is a towering stratovolcano rising 4,322 meters (14,179 feet) in northern California,
                dominating the landscape as a solitary, glacier-clad peak visible for over 100 miles. For the
                indigenous peoples of the region - including the Shasta, Wintu, Achumawi, Atsugewi, and Modoc -
                the mountain has been sacred since time immemorial, considered the home of the Great Spirit and
                the place where the Creator made the first people. In modern times, Mount Shasta has become a
                global center for New Age spirituality, attracting seekers who believe it is a powerful energy
                vortex, a UFO landing site, and the home of Lemurian survivors living in an underground city
                called Telos. Few mountains in the world attract such diverse and intense spiritual attention.

description:
Explore temples, mountains, groves, and holy sites that have served as gateways between the human and divine realms
                across cultures and millennia. From ancient stone circles to living pilgrimage destinations, discover the places
                where heaven touches earth.
